poem:
Beyond the Vote  

In the hum of ballots cast,  
a shadow doubles its stride,  
ancient fears unmasking—  
a tremor beneath suits and ties.  

Coalitions whisper urgency,  
old roads yielding to crossroads,  
a continent holds its breath,  
where echoes of history  
meet the hollow clang of future.  

Balance wavers,  
in the silent watch of dawn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Conservatives poised to win German election but far-right AfD doubles support The conservative opposition CDU/CSU has won the most votes in Germany’s general election, exit polls indicated, but a surge by the far-right Alternative für Deutschland (AfD) party is likely to complicate the formation of a government ready to help spearhead a European response to new global threats. The CDU/CSU candidate, Friedrich Merz, appeared best placed to be tasked with forming a ruling coalition on". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
